00051 #ifndef EVAL_H
00052 #define EVAL_H
00053 
00054 #ifdef __cplusplus
00055 extern "C" {
00056 #endif
00057 
00058 #include <stdio.h>
00059 #include "host.h"
00060 #include "misc.h"
00061 #include "machine.h"
00062 
00063 /* forward declarations */
00064 struct eval_state_t;
00065 struct eval_value_t;
00066 
00067 /* an identifier evaluator, when an evaluator is instantiated, the user
00068    must supply a function of this type that returns the value of identifiers
00069    encountered in expressions */
00070 typedef struct eval_value_t               /* value of the identifier */
00071 (*eval_ident_t)(struct eval_state_t *es); /* ident string in es->tok_buf */
00072 
00073 /* expression tokens */
00074 enum eval_token_t {
00075   tok_ident,            /* user-valued identifiers */
00076   tok_const,            /* numeric literals */
00077   tok_plus,             /* `+' */
00078   tok_minus,            /* `-' */
00079   tok_mult,             /* `*' */
00080   tok_div,              /* `/' */
00081   tok_exp,              /* `^' */
00082   tok_log,              /* `!' */
00083   tok_oparen,           /* `(' */
00084   tok_cparen,           /* `)' */
00085   tok_eof,              /* end of file */
00086   tok_whitespace,       /* ` ', `\t', `\n' */
00087   tok_invalid           /* unrecognized token */
00088 };
00089 
00090 /* an evaluator state record */
00091 struct eval_state_t {
00092   const char *p;                        /* ptr to next char to consume from expr */
00093   const char *lastp;                    /* save space for token peeks */
00094   eval_ident_t f_eval_ident;    /* identifier evaluator */
00095   void *user_ptr;               /* user-supplied argument pointer */
00096   char tok_buf[512];            /* text of last token returned */
00097   enum eval_token_t peek_tok;   /* peek buffer, for one token look-ahead */
00098 };
00099 
00100 /* evaluation errors */
00101 enum eval_err_t {
00102   ERR_NOERR,                    /* no error */
00103   ERR_UPAREN,                   /* unmatched parenthesis */
00104   ERR_NOTERM,                   /* expression term is missing */
00105   ERR_DIV0,                     /* divide by zero */
00106   ERR_BADCONST,                 /* badly formed constant */
00107   ERR_BADEXPR,                  /* badly formed constant */
00108   ERR_UNDEFVAR,                 /* variable is undefined */
00109   ERR_EXTRA,                    /* extra characters at end of expression */
00110   ERR_NUM
00111 };
00112 
00113 /* expression evaluation error, this must be a global */
00114 extern enum eval_err_t eval_error /* = ERR_NOERR */;
00115 
00116 /* enum eval_err_t -> error description string map */
00117 extern char *eval_err_str[ERR_NUM];
00118 
00119 /* expression value types */
00120 enum eval_type_t {
00121   et_int,                       /* signed integer result */
00122   et_uint,                      /* unsigned integer result */
00123   et_addr,                      /* address value */
00124   et_qword,                     /* unsigned qword length integer result */
00125   et_sqword,                    /* signed qword length integer result */
00126   et_float,                     /* single-precision floating point value */
00127   et_double,                    /* double-precision floating point value */
00128   et_symbol,                    /* non-numeric result (!allowed in exprs)*/
00129   et_NUM
00130 };
00131 
00132 /* non-zero if type is an integral type */
00133 #define EVAL_INTEGRAL(TYPE)                                             \
00134   ((TYPE) == et_int || (TYPE) == et_uint || (TYPE) == et_addr           \
00135    || (TYPE) == et_qword || (TYPE) == et_sqword)
00136 
00137 /* enum eval_type_t -> expression type description string map */
00138 extern char *eval_type_str[et_NUM];
00139 
00140 /* an expression value */
00141 struct eval_value_t {
00142   enum eval_type_t type;                /* type of expression value */
00143   union {
00144     int as_int;                         /* value for type == et_int */
00145     unsigned int as_uint;               /* value for type == et_uint */
00146     md_addr_t as_addr;                  /* value for type == et_addr */
00147     qword_t as_qword;                   /* value for type == ec_qword */
00148     sqword_t as_sqword;                 /* value for type == ec_sqword */
00149     float as_float;                     /* value for type == et_float */
00150     double as_double;                   /* value for type == et_double */
00151     const char *as_symbol;                      /* value for type == et_symbol */
00152   } value;
00153 };
00154 
00155 /*
00156  * expression value arithmetic conversions
00157  */
00158 
00159 /* eval_value_t (any numeric type) -> double */
00160 double eval_as_double(struct eval_value_t val);
00161 
00162 /* eval_value_t (any numeric type) -> float */
00163 float eval_as_float(struct eval_value_t val);
00164 
00165 /* eval_value_t (any numeric type) -> qword_t */
00166 qword_t eval_as_qword(struct eval_value_t val);
00167 
00168 /* eval_value_t (any numeric type) -> sqword_t */
00169 sqword_t eval_as_sqword(struct eval_value_t val);
00170 
00171 /* eval_value_t (any numeric type) -> md_addr_t */
00172 md_addr_t eval_as_addr(struct eval_value_t val);
00173 
00174 /* eval_value_t (any numeric type) -> unsigned int */
00175 unsigned int eval_as_uint(struct eval_value_t val);
00176 
00177 /* eval_value_t (any numeric type) -> int */
00178 int eval_as_int(struct eval_value_t val);
00179 
00180 /* create an evaluator */
00181 struct eval_state_t *                   /* expression evaluator */
00182 eval_new(eval_ident_t f_eval_ident,     /* user ident evaluator */
00183          void *user_ptr);               /* user ptr passed to ident fn */
00184 
00185 /* delete an evaluator */
00186 void
00187 eval_delete(struct eval_state_t *es);   /* evaluator to delete */
00188 
00189 /* evaluate an expression, if an error occurs during evaluation, the
00190    global variable eval_error will be set to a value other than ERR_NOERR
00191    NOTE: Order of evaluation is indeterminant, use parens for ordering
00192    of complex expressions. */
00193 struct eval_value_t                     /* value of the expression */
00194 eval_expr(struct eval_state_t *es,      /* expression evaluator */
00195           const char *p,                        /* ptr to expression string */
00196           const char **endp);                   /* returns ptr to 1st unused char */
00197 
00198 /* print an expression value */
00199 void
00200 eval_print(FILE *stream,                /* output stream */
00201            struct eval_value_t val);    /* expression value to print */
00202 
00203 #ifdef __cplusplus
00204 }
00205 #endif
00206 
00207 #endif /* EVAL_H */
